title: How to Use Line Rider

steps.headline: Click on "movies" to get an idea of what line rider is all about and see what you are aiming for.
steps.description: You can also read the "about" section.

steps.headline: Select the pencil tool at the top and the blue square to get onto regular pencil (the pencil indicates pencil (or freehand) and the blue shows it is regular.
steps.description: However, this is selected by default when you start the game.

steps.headline: Draw a curve similar to the bottom-left quarter of a circle or oval by clicking and dragging.
steps.description: This is the best way for a beginner to start a track.

steps.headline: Select the line tool which is next to the pencil.
steps.description: Again you can draw a line by clicking and dragging.

steps.headline: Speed up your sledger using a red tool (line or pencil) which indicates acceleration.
Test your track so far by clicking on the arrow (next to the hand).
steps.description: If you don't want your sledger to start at the point you started drawing then click and drag the red circled S while press the 'D' key on your keyboard.

steps.headline: Continue building up your track using a combination of the pencil and line tool in red and blue.
steps.description: Keep testing it regularly, ideally your man should stay on his sledge but there is no winning of this game so feel free to let him continue riding sledgeless (he doesn't mind). Press down Shift while drawing your track to make it go backwards. Remember your man will only ride on the black side of the line. This means that you have the draw the line in the direction you want the man to ride in. (Note that in acceleration mode the arrows point slightly in opposite direction to the one the sledger with travel in). Use the tool in the shape of a hand to click and drag the page across and draw more track.

steps.headline: Decorate your track using tools (pencil or line) in green.
steps.description: Green track does not affect your sledger. You can see it but you cannot ride it.

steps.headline: Save your best tracks by clicking the Floppy Disk icon.
steps.description: Name it something sensible and click save.

steps.headline: Go to the floppy disk next time to load your saved tracks.

text: Go to linerider.com  Click on "movies" to get an idea of what line rider is all about and see what you are aiming for. You can also read the "about" section. Click on "Home" and "Play Linerider (TM) now! ". Click "Play" and then "Continue".  Select the pencil tool at the top and the blue square to get onto regular pencil (the pencil indicates pencil (or freehand) and the blue shows it is regular. However, this is selected by default when you start the game. Draw a curve similar to the bottom-left quarter of a circle or oval by clicking and dragging. This is the best way for a beginner to start a track. Select the line tool which is next to the pencil. Again you can draw a line by clicking and dragging. Speed up your sledger using a red tool (line or pencil) which indicates acceleration.  Test your track so far by clicking on the arrow (next to the hand). If you don't want your sledger to start at the point you started drawing then click and drag the red circled S while press the 'D' key on your keyboard. Continue building up your track using a combination of the pencil and line tool in red and blue. Keep testing it regularly, ideally your man should stay on his sledge but there is no winning of this game so feel free to let him continue riding sledgeless (he doesn't mind). Press down Shift while drawing your track to make it go backwards. Remember your man will only ride on the black side of the line. This means that you have the draw the line in the direction you want the man to ride in. (Note that in acceleration mode the arrows point slightly in opposite direction to the one the sledger with travel in). Use the tool in the shape of a hand to click and drag the page across and draw more track. Decorate your track using tools (pencil or line) in green. Green track does not affect your sledger. You can see it but you cannot ride it. Save your best tracks by clicking the Floppy Disk icon. Name it something sensible and click save. Go to the floppy disk next time to load your saved tracks.
